main event: A witness in Dallas, Texas reported seeing unusual aerial phenomena.
interesting points: The Naval Intelligence Command observed unidentified aerial objects over the Dallas area on April 15, 1963, but had no report of the witness's observations.

The Air Force explained that objects may appear to glow in the air due to an illusion caused by the contrast with the dark background, and that balloons, high-flying planes, or birds with white undersides can also give this appearance.
The Air Force provided the witness with information on sightings of Unidentified Flying Objects and how the Air Force investigates and evaluates these reports.
The Air Force concluded that the sighting was possibly a balloon or aircraft.
The length of the observation and the number of objects were not reported.
